title: Line width of logs is highly truncated on Jupyter Lab

labels.name: wontfix
labels.description: This will not be worked on

body:
Running with the RichHandler() in Jupyter Lab runs into issues where the output does not seem to be able to access the full width of the Jupyter terminal, while the original logging stream handler performs fine.

I've tried messing with the available params for RichHandler() but none of them seem to solve the issue (in this screenshot you can see I've tried `traceback_width`.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/21179283/102292266-c7c67280-3f7f-11eb-9801-d351178ce7f9.png)

**To Reproduce** 
Sample code:
```
import sys
import logging
from rich.logging import RichHandler

logger = logging.getLogger()

formatter = logging.Formatter('%(asctime)s - %(name)s:%(lineno)d - %(levelname)s - %(message)s')
shandler = logging.StreamHandler(sys.stdout)
shandler.setFormatter(formatter)
logger.addHandler(shandler)
logger.addHandler(RichHandler(highlighter=None, rich_tracebacks=True, tracebacks_show_locals=True, tracebacks_width=300, locals_max_string=100))
logger.setLevel(logging.INFO)

logger.info("This is a line that is 168 characters long"*4)

# Traceback box also gets truncated
try:
    1/0
except:
    logger.exception("Error! A really long error message that describes the problem...")
```

**Platform**
Chrome
